title: Textile, 1810–20
medium: Technique: roller printed on plain weave
inscribed: On B only, "F. Pieters" integrated into design.
dimensions:
Warp x Weft (a): 96 x 62 cm (37 13/16 x 24 7/16 in.)
Warp x Weft (b): 88.5 x 56 cm (34 13/16 x 22 1/16 in.)
Repeat H: 56 cm (22 1/16 in.)
creditline: Gift of W. and J. Sloane
description: Components a and b are needed to complete the design. Four scenes illustrating the story of Robinson Crusoe. One scene shows Crusoe arriving on a raft, another teaching a parrot to talk, another with two men (Man Friday?) emerging from the water and the fourth of man in animal skins walking with gun and equipment. In brown (originally) purple) on white.

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1810–20.
1810–20. Technique: roller printed on plain weave. Gift of W. and J. Sloane. 1943-43-42-a,b.
